SmartLab is a booking app exclusivly for LAB workers aimed at optimizing their working schedules to achieve effective utilization of resources and workspace.

Type
Individual course project
Deliverables
Wireframes;
Prototypes (mobile)
Timeline
2018-09-04 - 2018-09-30

How can I help scientists to improve work efficiency

As a scientist by myself, I watched many researchers having the same trouble on improving their work efficiency.
The nature of work requires them to perform multiple tasks with different timelines, equipments and locations in parallel. Meanwhile, they have to memorize all the checkpoints and document any observations and results they got during the experiments.

Take-away: A schedule management system may help to increase lab workers' efficiency.
User research results summary

Learning from user researches

Possible solutions based on user needs:


  • Share schedule with others in a sharing workspace;
  • Optimize work schedule to minimize fragmented time within each experiment;
  • Document experimental details to maintain repeatable results;
  • Arrange work order to avoid energy wasting on traveling between multiple operational locations.
Persona - Meet Tanner
User Journey - Daily work schedule

Researvation system is a promising solution

After analyzing a LAB workspace layout, I found it can be divided into several blocks based on its functionality. Although various problems may happen in each block, designing a reservation system becomes a common solution for addressing problems across different blocks.

LAB workspace analysis

Final concept

Combining the features of reservation, path calculation and schedule management, I designed a system being able to optimize a customized working plan based on usersâ€™ needs.

  • Meeting Room Reservation System (Cisco): Avoid conflicts of work space or equipments;
  • Notes & Reminder (Google Calendar): Keep experimental details;
  • Time Management (Mapquest app): Utilize waiting time during each experiment;
  • Path Finder (Amazon Robotics): Save energy by decreasing traveling.
Workflow
Style guide and initial wireframes
Wire-flow with function highlights
Prototype - Signin Page Login is requested for the first user because protocols and workspace layout are linked with user account.
Prototype - Researvation Page Main function of the app. Reservation is made by scheduling function blocks in the lab. Each reservation also contains setting reminder, seeing & contacting booked users, etc. "Create" button is highlighted on the center of the screen.
Prototype - Evaluation page Provides users analytical results based on current schedule. Two display modes to choose.
Prototype - Profile page Storage user frequently used protocols and contacts

What have I learned

This is the first UX & UI project I initiated after I switched my gear from science field to design. I want to start this project out of my own experience on laboratory research.
One thing I learned from this process is that deisgn isn't a one-way road, each step could be iterated. This is quite similar to a research process. The other thing is how to choose between multi-purpose app and single-purpose app. Multi-purpose may have advantges of functionality while single-purpose can create a focus and target a specific group of people.
